thread.title: Fiat Chrysler's Huge Fine Takes Stock Down A Peg

title: Fiat Chrysler's Huge Fine Takes Stock Down A Peg
text:
China Stocks Suffer Sharpest Plunge Since 2007 
The efforts of China's government to tame its unruly stock markets hit a big speed bump Monday, as Chinese shares suffered their sharpest plunge in eight years. Concerns about China's slowing economic growth as well as doubts about the effectiveness of Beijing's stimulus and support measures for ... 01:13 PM ET Apple, Caterpillar Point To China's Uneven Transition 
A raft of warnings from U.S. multinationals about their Chinese operations may indicate China's transition away from investment-focused growth is on track â€” but not going as smoothly as official data suggest. In the past week, Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT) cited reduced construction work in China ... 07/24/2015 06:57 PM ET Firms Add To China Warnings 
3 U.S. multinationals' woes in China indicate the country's transition from manufacturing-heavy growth to a more consumer-based economy may not be going quite as smoothly as planned. Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT) and United Technologies (NYSE:UTX) were among industrial giants that got hurt in China. GM ... 07/24/2015 06:52 PM ET GM Posts Strong Q2 Profits, Sees Momentum Building 
General Motors (NYSE:GM) shares climbed early Thursday after its second-quarter profit came in better than expected on strong growth in the U.S. especially in the truck market, despite challenges in China. Earnings before interest and taxes (EBIT) reached $2.9 billion, up from $1.4 billion a year ... 07/23/2015 01:29 PM ET Stock Futures Up, But Volatile; SanDisk, Cirrus, Fortinet Soar 
Stock futures were off to a neck-wrenching start Thursday, as earnings reports powered a volatile premarket session. Dow futures were up and down, showing a 4-point gain vs. fair market value 45 minutes before the start of regular trade. S&P 500 futures were up 1.6 points. Nasdaq 100 futures ... 07/23/2015 09:17 AM ET GE Plans Energy Storage Moves As Tesla Eyes Market 
General Electric (NYSE:GE) reportedly plans on having a big role in energy storage, which is key to managing power volatility from energy surges and intermittent power sources like wind and solar. In an interview with Reuters, Jeff Wyatt, GE's head of energy storage, said the industrial ... 01:58 PM ET Whole Foods Q3 Seen Slowing, Delivery Poised To Gain 
Upscale grocer Whole Foods Market (NASDAQ:WFM) is expected to report slowing earnings and revenue growth after the close Wednesday, but one analyst sees potential to grab market share in the online grocery delivery space. Wall Street anticipates earnings rising about 10% to 45 cents a share, which ... 01:58 PM ET Planet Fitness Sets Terms For $203 Million IPO 
Planet Fitness set terms for an initial public offering that looks to raise $203 million for the franchisers and operators of fitness centers. Planet Fitness will offer 13.5 million shares at a price range of 14 to 16. It will list on the NYSE under the ticker PLNT. "We believe we are the largest ... 01:30 PM ET McGraw Hill Financial Leads Latest Acquisition Wave 
McGraw Hill Financial (NYSE:MHFI) agreed to buy SNL Financial for about $2.225 billion cash and released mixed second-quarter earnings results amid a raft of acquisitions in various industries announced early Monday. M&A activity has intensified this year in what various analyst reports have ... 01:12 PM ET Will Q2 Earnings Help Skechers' Stock Keep Running? 
Skechers' (NYSE:SKX) share price has more than doubled in 2015, and the shoemaker is seen continuing its streak of double-digit earnings and sales growth when it reports second-quarter results after the close on Wednesday. Analysts polled by Thomson Reuters expect earnings to jump 49% to $1.01 a ... 11:21 AM ET
